body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue
I installed spack on a RedHat 7.9 system (develop branch) and try to install any package, e.g. ncurses

```console
$ spack install -v ncurses
```

### Error Message

<!-- If Spack reported an error, provide the error message. If it did not report an error but the output appears incorrect, provide the incorrect output. If there was no error message and no output but the result is incorrect, describe how it does not match what you expect. -->
The following error is shown:
```console
Error: UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't decode byte 0xf0 in position 0: invalid continuation byte

/home/myuser/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_environment.py:863, in child_process:
        860            tb_string = traceback.format_exc()
        861
        862            # build up some context from the offending package so we can
  >>    863            # show that, too.
        864            package_context = get_package_context(tb)
        865
        866            build_log = None

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/myuser/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_environment.py", line 812, in child_process
    setup_package(pkg, dirty=dirty)
  File "/home/myuser/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_environment.py", line 729, in setup_package
    module('unload', 'cray-libsci')
  File "/home/myuser/spack/lib/spack/spack/util/module_cmd.py", line 39, in module
    env_output = str(module_p.communicate()[0].decode())
UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't decode byte 0xf0 in position 0: invalid continuation byte

```


### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->
* **Spack:** 0.15.4-1902-e80276c
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-rhel7-broadwell


<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->
Since spack ran fine for a long time, I did a git bisect, with the following results:
`dd3762d0f936aca41d11deb033e56d68d2036f2f is the first bad commit`
So [this](https://github.com/spack/spack/commit/dd3762d0f936aca41d11deb033e56d68d2036f2f) is the first bad commit, if I checkout a commit before I can build the package as expected.
I don't have the time today to look into the issue any longer, maybe someone has an idea?

### Additional information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output

title: Error: UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't decode byte 0xf0 in position 0: invalid continuation byte
